context.p:
A Project (alternatively known as a Tenancy) within the Deployment Inventory Tool is a representation of a project within the associated cloud Pod. Projects own specific resources in an OpenStack environment.
Project information is used to auto-populate certain SED parameters. For example, the IPv4/IPv6 addresses are generated by the DIT auto population logic using the project IPv4/IPv6 ranges.
Create a new project for the Deployment Inventory Tool

strow.stentry: The listed SED parameter values are derived from the project name, in conjunction with naming conventions
Used to identify the project in Openstack
Start of range from which IPv4 addresses will be auto populated in the SED
End of range from which IPv4 addresses will be auto populated in the SED
Start of range from which IPv6 addresses will be auto populated in the SED
End of range from which IPv6 addresses will be auto populated in the SED
List of IPv4 addresses not be used during auto-population in the 'ENM SED'
List of IPv6 addresses not be used during auto-population in the 'ENM SED'

context.p: *Some parameters may not be present in a document depending on the schema version used

prereq.p: To create a new project the user must have the following:

ul.li: Associated Pod already created in the tool
If required IPv6 Range, associated Pod's network must have IPv6 Subnet otherwise the Add IPv6 Range button will be disabled.

info.p: Click the project view from the nav bar at the top
Click the Create new project button as shown below
Enter the details as shown below.
NOTE: Restrictions on the fields are as follows:

ul.li: Name must be unique within pod and unique when paired with Openstack Project Id
Pod must be an existing pod that the user has created
Network at least one valid network is needed and must not overlap with network for another project
IPv4 and IPv6 Start must be a valid address
IPv4 and IPv6 End must be a valid address
Exclusion IPv4 and IPv6 Addresses must be a valid list of addresses

info.p: Click the Save button and you will be redirected back to the previous page where you can see the newly created project as well as the pod it resides in with new options to edit and delete that project.
NOTE: Project will not save if any fields are invalid (RED in UI)

result.p: A New Project is created in the Deployment Inventory Tool.
